intro: Helipterum spicatum var. pallens, commonly known as the pale helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sandy areas.
